intro: Tephrosia parviflora, commonly known as smallflower tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Tephrosia parviflora is also valued for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
